body_html: It's actually something different. In your second example you're raising the input to 2nd power, not to the third, which triggers an optimized path in NumPy (that just executed x * x). When I change ** 2 to ** 3, the run time raises from 3ms to 38ms
body_text: It's actually something different. In your second example you're raising the input to 2nd power, not to the third, which triggers an optimized path in NumPy (that just executed x * x). When I change ** 2 to ** 3, the run time raises from 3ms to 38ms
body: It's actually something different. In your second example you're raising the input to 2nd power, not to the third, which triggers an optimized path in NumPy (that just executed `x * x`). When I change `** 2` to `** 3`, the run time raises from 3ms to 38ms
